Dispute_Type: Land dispute with potential ethnic tensions
Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of dismissal of refugee claim under sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Credibility_Assessment: Credibility questioned due to inconsistent evidence and prolonged stay in Burundi despite claimed threats
Legal_Provision: Section 96 (persecution based on ethnicity), Section 97 (personal danger of torture, life risk, or cruel treatment)
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to establish ethnic persecution, unclear identity of persecutor, credibility issues
Review_Outcome: Dismissed, no general importance question certified
Legal_Standard: Proof of persecution or personal danger under IRPA s. 96 and s. 97
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Refugee Protection Division
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence, failure to prove ethnic persecution, inconsistent statements
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent evidence, prolonged presence in country of alleged persecution
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging reasonableness of dismissal
